page.title: 01Acton/Gt Waldingfield-Intro.
page.content: The 12 km square survey area lies to the north east of Sudbury.The physical landscape is one of gently rolling countryside averaging about 60 metres above sea level and consisting of glacial boulder clay.The land,for the most part,is used for arable farming. There are two villages within the area,Acton and Great Waldingfield both of which have experienced considerable residential growth in recent years.In each of the parishes are outlying hamlets Newmans Green and Upsher Green respectively. The following survey concentrates largely on the agricultural nature of the area and social aspects of village life in the mid 1980's.The latter is reflective of the technological and demographic changes of recent years.
